title: [Discussion] Is there any way to release memory after separating is done??
body:
I need to process multiple audio files in a loop.
I've been unable to find a solution to ensure that memory is properly released after the separation task is completed.
I'd greatly appreciate any insights, suggestions, or experiences.
author: hijam-git

comments.body:
I solved it by running separator jobs in a worker process.
Exited process releases all the memory.

```
def target():
    separator = Separator('spleeter:2stems')
    separator.separate_to_file(input_file, output_file, duration=None)
    
proc = Process(target=target)
proc.start()
proc.join()

title: Downloading Pretrain models to all folders
body:
I have some file in **C:/Users/myfile.mp3 and D:/myfile.mp3 and E:/myfile.mp3** when i try to split it by command prompt like C:\Users>**spleeter separate -f {filename}/{filename}-{instrument}.{codec} -c "mp3" -b "128" -o output  -p spleeter:2stems-16kHz -i "myfile.mp3"**
D:\>**spleeter separate -f {filename}/{filename}-{instrument}.{codec} -c "mp3" -b "128" -o output  -p spleeter:2stems-16kHz -i "myfile.mp3"**
E:\>**spleeter separate -f {filename}/{filename}-{instrument}.{codec} -c "mp3" -b "128" -o output  -p spleeter:2stems-16kHz -i "myfile.mp3"**

 spleeter is downloading pretrain models to all folders like C:/Users/pretrainmodel, D:/pretrainmodel and E:/pretrainmodel so how to avoid/override or link it to one folder like C:/User/pretrainmodels only. using command prompt to working with spleeter
author: iamsudheerkabeer

comments.body:
Hi @sudheervdm,
you can set the `MODEL_PATH` env variable to the folder where you want to store the model, so that `spleeter` will always look in this folder to retrieve the model (or will download it in this folder at the first call).
Also, be aware that a single call to spleeter with multiple files to separate is more efficient than multiple calls.

title: the question of the audio separate time
body:
Excuse me, is the separated audio file just the first ten minutes of audio?
What to do if the original audio is longer than ten minutes？
author: mtz1992

comments.body:
Hi @mtz1992,
As already mentioned in several issues (such as #274 ), 10 min (600s) is just the default value of the `--duration` parameter of the `spleeter separate` command. 
It can be set to any value, but be aware that you may encounter memory issues if trying to separate too big files.

title: [Discussion] Why files outputted by splitter is three times bigger than initial file?
body:
<!-- Please respect the title [Discussion] tag. -->
Thanks for the awesome project guys. I am wondering why outputted files are much bigger than the initial file?
For example, my initial file was 9mb and the vocal I got after processing 36mb.
author: Werter12

comments.body:
Hi @Werter12,
There are several reasons for the output files having a bigger size than the input one's:
- the audio codec/bitrate is not the same: Spleeter outputs wav/PCM 16 bits with 44.1kHz sampling rate by default (so a bit rate of 1440kbps). So if your input is mp3 or aac @320kpbs, then the output files will be 4.5x bigger than the input. you can set the output audio codec with the `-c` option and the output audio bitrate with the `-b` option.
- the input file is mono: then Spleeter will actually start by converting it to stereo, process the file as stereo and output stereo files (so 2x bigger than input).

title: [Discussion] Output in FLAC or other formats
body:
Hi,
I was wondering if it is possible to to export the output files in other formats than WMA. I would be interested in having the files as FLAC, is it already possible to do so ?

I thank you in advance for your time and comprehension towards my request.
author: leops95

comments.body:
Hi @leops95,
yes it is possible to export as `flac` using the `-c`option, as mentioned in the help (`spleeter separate -h`): 
```
-c {wav,mp3,ogg,m4a,wma,flac}, --codec {wav,mp3,ogg,m4a,wma,flac}
                        Audio codec to be used for the separated output
```

title: [Discussion] How to correctly set bitrate?
body:
I have set command in order to have vocal and accomaniment in flac format, at a bitrate of 320kbps in 'output' destination folder.
What I wrote:

`spleeter separate -i 'songName.flac' -p spleeter:2stems -c flac -b 320k -o output`

What i get is two flac files (ok), but with higher bitrate than the one request by parameter `-b 320k`

Is there something wrong in wrinting the command? How should the bitrate parameter be written? (there's no explanation on that by reading the manual)
author: Alessandro1996

comments.body:
Hi Alessandro,

Flac is a lossless compression format and it's output bitrate depends on the audio that you are compressing (you can think of it as zip on audio files), therefore setting a target bitrate in this case does not make sense and the parameter is ignored by ffmpeg at the encoding step.
For cases such as PCM wave, the bitrate is actually calculated by other parameters, like sampling rate, bit depth and channels. Multiply all together, probably. It's not an independent variable.
